Dr. Heather Lynn Heiman and Dr. Stephen David Persell, residents in internal medicine at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, are to be married today. William D. Persell, the Episcopal bishop of Chicago and an uncle of the bridegroom, is to perform the ceremony at the Deerpark Restaurant in Asheville, N.C.
The couple received medical degrees from Harvard University.

Dr. Heiman, 28, is keeping her name. She graduated from Duke. Her adoptive father, Dr. Jay Jacoby, is a professor of English at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte. Her mother, Marlene Jacoby, teaches biology at Charlotte Country Day School. They live in Charlotte, where her father, the late Dr. Edward Heiman, was a psychiatrist.

Dr. Persell, 30, graduated from Haverford College. His parents, Dr. Caroline Hodges Persell and Charles Persell, live in New York. His mother is a professor of sociology at New York University. His father retired as the executive vice president of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.
